results.title: The Man Who Named the World/Declaration of a Heretic
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Visionaries”.
“The Man who named the World” - Professor James Lovelock is responsible for one of the most revolutionary environmental ideas - the Gaia hypothesis. This says that the planet is more than a cosmic sphere brimming with life, it is a single organism that has been alive for three and a half billion years. “Declaration of a Heretic” - Jeremy Rivkin is a professional activist. For many years his Foundation on Economic Trends has challenged the bio sciences in the court rooms. He was responsible for preventing the release of genetically engineered bacteria onto Californian strawberry crops, he’s putting the brakes on the Human Genome Project, and he’s forced the genetic engineers to conduct their experiments in an atmosphere of public scrutiny. Rated: G

results.title: The Man who loves frogs: Mike Tyler
results.brief_description: One man’s look at the enormous variety of frog species found in Australia, the differences between them, and the ways each has adapted to its own particular lifestyle/environment.

results.title: The Man who loved machines
results.creator_credit: Sidney Goldsmith, David Verrall and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A humorous, animated science film that introduces students to the nature of energy and energy conservation, as well as to the second law of thermodynamics, entropy. The points are underscored by the observations of an all-seeing dog in need of a doghouse, whose master, though obsessed with machines, is finally convinced that the simplest tool is sometimes the most energy-efficient! Voice and Narration by Terrence Labrosse. Music by Peter Mendieta.

results.title: The Man who knows: Marcus Wallenberg
results.creator_credit: Denis Postle, Anthony de Lotbinière and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Pacemakers”.
Marcus Wallenberg is not the only man behind Sweden’s success, but he is almost certainly the most outstanding. A study of his methods gives an insight into Sweden’s prosperity. He and his brother Jacob are each chairman of ten companies and on the boards of a further fifty, and are closely involved with five of Sweden’s eight leading firms. Through the drive of men like the Wallenbergs Sweden, with a population of only seven and a half million, has become an object lesson for the smaller industrial nations of the world.

results.title: The Man who digs for fish
results.creator_credit: Jack Long, John Taylor and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Frank Jenkinson, eighty-two, has been digging for fish for twenty-five years. His unorthodox conservationist practices have increased the numbers of the salmon population in the Jarvis Inlet from a modest 500 to 25000. Using a spade and accompanied by his dog, Frank wades up and down the stream, digging for the newly hatched salmon that lie buried in the gravel. Without his intervention they risk dying before reaching maturity.

results.title: The Man who can't stop
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubbo, Richard Mason, Tom Daly, Film Australia and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Tells of the efforts of Francis Sutton to save the Australian coastline from pollution. Dedicated to this task Sutton works ceaselessly on maps, diagrams and plans in an attempt to find an alternative to the disposal of sewage through ocean outfalls. Though receiving many rebuffs, gradually he is gaining support, from a scientist, politician and from the people who live around him. Cinematography by Don McAlpine.

results.title: The Man that gravity forgot
results.creator_credit: Wijnand Nieuwenkam, Auricom Van Gelber and Coronet
results.brief_description: An animated film about the life of Bram, the only person in the world who is not affected by the force of gravity. As Bram narrates this account of his gravity-free life he presents basic scientific information about gravity, and reveals the important role that this force plays in our lives.

results.title: The Man of the beatitudes
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Vincenzo Labella and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: in the olive grove Jesus sends his disciples off to their mission; John visits Mary the mother of Jesus; assault on Herod, the zealots manage to wound him; the Zealots arrested and killed in front of Herod’s palace; the Sermon on the Mount, the beatitudes, the Our Father; Peter tries to stop Jesus from going to Jerusalem; the crowds journey to Jerusalem for the festival; a messenger from Martha and Mary comes to Jesus; Jesus arrives at Bethany and learns that Lazarus has died; Martha and Mary convince Jesus to visit the tomb of Lazarus; Jesus raises Lazarus from the dead.

results.title: The Man of fashion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Discusses, in humorous fashion, the evolution of men’s clothes, showing how details of dress have evolved over the years. The role of fashion is portrayed in the work of a master tailor, fitting an Englishman in the latest style. From this new style a new trend may emerge in the fashionable West End of London and spread to tailoring establishments throughout the country.

results.title: The Man in the mirror
results.creator_credit: Amram Nowak Associates and BNA Communications
results.brief_description: Using “Bert” a typical surburban dad/husband/managing executive, to show the mid-life crisis in home and especially at work. “Phil” a young executive has new innovative plans for the company but Bert is too threatened to pass on Phil’s ideas. Phil resigns and Bert gets questioned about it by his superior. The film is based on books written by Joe Batten.
